revised_title: Examining the Dispute Between Hevelius and Auzout on the Observation of the First Comet
tldr: English astronomers examine the dispute between Hevelius and Auzout regarding the observation of the first of two comets. They conclude that the comet did not pass near the star in the left ear of Aries, as claimed by Hevelius, but rather near the bright star in its left horn according to Bayer's tables. The observations of other astronomers, including French, Italian, and Dutch, support this conclusion.
